intro: Lagochilus olgae, commonly known as the Alaskan fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Lagochilus olgae is often found in the Yukon and Alaska, where it thrives in cold, arid environments.
